reasons.title: Folder/file manipulation in dialog boxes
reasons.description:
Filesystem-related dialog boxes (such as Save or Open) in Windows are like miniature file explorer windows; you can do nearly anything in them. Dialog boxes in OS X make me feel so shackled in comparison.

Let's say I export a file from Photoshop, then I check my desktop because that's where I thought it saved. Rather than searching, I can export again, then drag the file out the dialog box and onto my desktop.

reasons.title: Address bar with full path
reasons.description: So simple, so useful. Windows shows you the path tree to the current directory, and it lets you copy that path to the clipboard.

reasons.title: Copy as path
reasons.description: Hold shift when right-clicking on a file, and you can copy the path to that file to your clipboard. Convenient when uploading something to a site or attaching a document to an email. Looks like this feature may now be available on El Capitan!

reasons.title: Create files from context menu
reasons.description: Want to create a new file some place, then open it in some program for editing? Sort of like touching a file on the command line, then opening it in vim for content. Windows lets you create new files with a right click of the mouse, whereas OS X forces you to create files from within the program for that file.

reasons.title: Install multiple fonts from context menu
reasons.description: Explorer lets you highlight a bunch of fonts, right click, then install them. The only way to install fonts in OS X is to open FontBook and drag them in.

reasons.title: Thumbnail previews for PSD, AI, etc.
reasons.description: Finder shows thumbnails for Photoshop, raw camera, and other obscure graphic files, which is great for us designers. Add a better version of this feature to Explorer with FastPictureViewer's Codec Pack.

reasons.title: Multiple tabs in Finder
reasons.description: It's great that OS X has multiple tabs built into Finder. Add a better version of this feature to Explorer with Clover, and its Chrome-like tabs are far superior in my book.

reasons.title: Cover flow
reasons.description: Cover flow view seems great; it shows columns as you drill down. But tough to get back to the top level when youâ€™re far down.

reasons.title: Spacebar preview
reasons.description: Click an image, tap the spacebar, and see a preview of it. It even works with Photoshop, etc. files. I haven't found a comparable alternative in Windows.

reasons.title: Cannot get total file size of everything inside a folder
reasons.description: Right-click, Get info on multiple files will open an Info window for each file individually (bad, terrible, wicked).

reasons.title: Home/End work like they should
reasons.description: Home and End go to the beginning or end of the current line. Ctrl+Home and Ctrl+End jump to beginning or end of the current document. Why did OS X mess this up so badly?

reasons.title: Windows+L locks computer
reasons.description: Need to go for a coffee break? Just hit this key combination to lock your computer, requiring a password to get back in. Simple.

reasons.title: The command key
reasons.description: You can have this one. Using my thumb on the command key for shortcuts saves my poor pinky a lot of pain.
